channel.title: External HDD
channel.description:
I'm curious about what the 8MB in this title stands for. Thinking about buying it, but that has spiked my curiosity, and I cant seem to find anything on it.
Seagate FreeAgent (250 GB, USB 2.0, 8 MB) HDD

item.title: External HDD
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:8, topic:349876”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=446250.msg3275138#msg3275138 date=1279484586]

[quote author=pure2ownage link=topic=446250.msg3275129#msg3275129 date=1279484076]

Or… 8mb paging file? Or… 8mb file transfering speed? Or… 8mb of RAM dedicated to CoonRaper.

Paging files are assigned via windows. Transferring speed, naa, that would be way slow. Ram, that would be epic, but nty lmfao.

http://www.provantage.com/seagate-st902503fga2e1-rk~7SEGR040.htm

Kihomura was right.

Not sure why i never though of a cache buffer for a HDD, but hey, looks like I got a new external for $25
[/quote]thought* just go grab some more USB sticks and use 'em as ram bro

That only worked on my old computer, because the ram was 126MB/s transfer rate, and the USB’s were faster. As for my newer laptop, the RAM is much faster, and I have 2304MB of ram atm anyways.
[/quote]How the fuck is that possible? 2x 1gb + 256mb?[/quote]

2GB sticks actually produce like 2048MB last time i checked =p

Ass a 256MB stick to it, and walaa…

Read full topic

item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:7, topic:349876”][quote author=pure2ownage link=topic=446250.msg3275129#msg3275129 date=1279484076]

Or… 8mb paging file? Or… 8mb file transfering speed? Or… 8mb of RAM dedicated to CoonRaper.

Paging files are assigned via windows. Transferring speed, naa, that would be way slow. Ram, that would be epic, but nty lmfao.

http://www.provantage.com/seagate-st902503fga2e1-rk~7SEGR040.htm

Kihomura was right.

Not sure why i never though of a cache buffer for a HDD, but hey, looks like I got a new external for $25
[/quote]thought* just go grab some more USB sticks and use 'em as ram bro

That only worked on my old computer, because the ram was 126MB/s transfer rate, and the USB’s were faster. As for my newer laptop, the RAM is much faster, and I have 2304MB of ram atm anyways.[/quote]How the fuck is that possible? 2x 1gb + 256mb?
